questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is the user doing with Drone in this automated test?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Drone CI runs postgres:9-alpine as a Docker container, not a virtual machine (VM), so "D" is not correct.
Only "C" sound correct to me.

choices.D: testing PostgreSQL deployment in an Alpine Linux VM
choices.A: testing Alpine Linux versus Ubuntu Linux
choices.B: testing a PostgreSQL DB against multiple architectures

questions.question_text:
An interface on a router as a Layer 3 link has been configured to another device by updating an Ansible playbook that is executed via a CI/CD pipeline. The
Ansible playbook was written to push the configuration change using the ios_config module. Which automated test validates that the interface is functioning as it should?

choices.B: Automated testing is already built in because the playbook execution is successful only after Ansible validates that it applied the change.
choices.C: Add a pipeline step that captures and parses the packet flow for the interface.
choices.D: Add a pipeline step that captures and parses the show ip interface output so that the operational state can be referenced.
choices.A: Add a pipeline step that runs the playbook a second type. If it does not modify the device on the second run, then the interface is correctly configured.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. Add a step to the CI/CD pipeline that runs a dynamic code analysis tool during the pipeline execution.
B. Add a step to the CI/CD pipeline that runs a static code analysis tool during the pipeline execution.

Selected Answer: AB
I agree with JM_Lee: A and B are correct.
I am certain of B: static code analysis like "bandit" can be used.
A is also a good answer, although the study materials don't seem to mention dynamic analysis.
C & D are nonsense
E. is a valid response, but maybe not as "an integral part of the software development lifecycle"

questions.question_text: Which two practices help make the security of an application a more integral part of the software development lifecycle? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Add a step to the CI/CD pipeline that runs a dynamic code analysis tool during the pipeline execution.
choices.E: Ensure that the code repository server has enabled drive encryption and stores the keys on a Trusted Platform Module or Hardware Security Module.
choices.C: Use only software modules that are written by the internal team.
choices.D: Add a step to the CI/CD pipeline to modify the release plan so that updated versions of the software are made available more often.
choices.B: Add a step to the CI/CD pipeline that runs a static code analysis tool during the pipeline execution.

discussion.content:
A & C

A build tool in an automated build pipeline should have the ability to run unit tests against the code that is committed (A). This ensures that the quality and correctness of the code are verified before proceeding with the build process. Running unit tests helps catch any issues or regressions early in the development process.

Additionally, the build tool should be capable of building your software when changes are committed (C). This ensures that the software is built automatically whenever changes are made to the codebase, allowing for continuous integration and rapid feedback on the impact of changes.

Selected Answer: AC
I agrees with A & C

Selected Answer: BC
I think "B" and "C"

choices.E: It must have a plug-in for Puppet and Maven.
choices.D: It builds your software every 500 milliseconds.
choices.C: It builds your software when changes are committed.
choices.A: It runs unit tests against code that is committed.
choices.B: It builds your software on the production environment.

questions.question_text: Which two characteristics of a build tool that is used in an automated build pipeline? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
ios_info is not an Ansible module. 

Instead, I would go with : 
ios_facts
register
ios_config
